newsitem.title: JAPAN: All Tokyo corn futures end sharply lower.
newsitem.headline: All Tokyo corn futures end sharply lower.

text.p: All Tokyo corn futures closed sharply lower on Thursday, due to active selling by local investors, who were discouraged by price falls in the Chicago market overnight, traders said.
The benchmark March 1998 contract closed 320 yen lower at 15,500 yen per tonne. The day's volume was 76,917 lots.
All contracts dropped sharply at the opening, as active selling emerged, and the bearish sentiment remained throughout the day, traders said.
Traders saw the 15,500 yen level as a near-term support line.
The spot March corn contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $3.00 per bushel at 0810 GMT, against $3.01-3/4 at Wednesday's close.
The CBOT soybean futures spot March was at $8.00-1/2 at 0810 GMT, down from $8.01-1/4 at Wednesday's close.
